pull_request.title: Ask Users to Consent to DRM
pull_request.body:
Task/Issue URL: https://app.asana.com/0/0/1205710253534924/f

### Description
* Add consent prompt for DRM
* Incidentally, fix issue where permission was not explicitly denied if it's set to "not allowed to ask"

### Steps to test this PR
_Session-based Consent_
- [ ] Load https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/ - DRM consent prompt should appear
- [ ] Select  "Only for this Session"
- [ ] Verify that you are able to play the 3rd video, Sintel (it's encrypted with Widevine)
- [ ] Reload the page and verify that you are still able to play the video and no dialog appears
- [ ] Open a new tab and go to https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/
- [ ] Consent prompt should appear - select "Deny for this Session"
- [ ] Verify that the 3rd video, Sintel, is not available
- [ ] Reload the page - video should still be unavailable and no consent prompt should appear

_Permanent Consent_
- [ ] Open a new tab and go to https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/
- [ ] Consent prompt should appear - select "Always"
- [ ] Open another new tab and go to https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/
- [ ] No consent prompt should appear and the Sintel video should still be playable
- [ ] Go to Settings --> Permissions --> Site Permissions
- [ ] Shaka Player domain should be in Manage Sites
- [ ] Click on it and verify that DRM is set to "Allow." Other permissions should remain at "Ask"
- [ ] Change DRM to "Ask" (note: there seems to be a pre-existing bug where it will display `"Ask" disabled for all sites` no matter which permission you set to "Ask," but will display correctly if you re-navigate to the per-site setting)
- [ ] Go back to the tab and reload the page
- [ ] Consent prompt should appear - select "Deny"
- [ ] Verify that the 3rd video, Sintel, is not available
- [ ] Open another new tab and go to https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/
- [ ] No consent prompt should appear and the Sintel video should still be unavailable

_Misc Settings_
- [ ] Continuing where we left off (shaka should still be in Site Permissions/Manage Sites) - use the Fire Button
- [ ] Verify that Site Permissions/Manage Sites is empty
- [ ] In "Allow all sites to ask for:" --> disable DRM
- [ ] Go to https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/
- [ ] No consent prompt should appear and the Sintel video should be unavailable

### UI changes
Added dialog for DRM permissions and added it as a permission item in Settings

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,6 +25,7 @@ data class SitePermissionsEntity(
     @PrimaryKey val domain: String,
     val askCameraSetting: String = ASK_EVERY_TIME.name,
     val askMicSetting: String = ASK_EVERY_TIME.name,
+    val askDrmSetting: String = ASK_EVERY_TIME.name,
comment.body: Changing an entity requires a DB migration otherwise will crash when updating the app and using this feature. In `SitePermissionsDatabase` you need to change the DB version from `1` to `2`.  It will also require to properly migrate the data to add the new column with ASK_EVERY_TIME as the default value.

             .show()
     }
 
+    private fun showSiteDrmPermissionsDialog(
+        activity: Activity,
+        url: String,
+        tabId: String,
+        request: PermissionRequest,
+    ) {
+        val domain = url.extractDomain() ?: url
+
+        // Check if user allowed or denied per session
+        val sessionSetting = sitePermissionsRepository.getDrmForSession(domain)
comment.body:
Hacky in which way?

Regardless of that I'm having seconds thoughts I think we should go with the 24h permission just because all the other ones work like that and remove this session thing for now.

_Permanent Consent_

- [ ] Open another new tab and go to https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/

- [ ] Go to Settings --> Permissions --> Site Permissions
- [ ] Shaka Player domain should be in Manage Sites
- [ ] Click on it and verify that DRM is set to "Allow." Other permissions should remain at "Ask"
- [ ] Change DRM to "Ask" (note: there seems to be a pre-existing bug where it will display `"Ask" disabled for all sites` no matter which permission you set to "Ask," but will display correctly if you re-navigate to the per-site setting)

comment.body:
Note: this would require a fair amount of changes. You can ignore.

This logic has always bothered me somehow. We are asking the permissions module for certain things and then passing that information down to the tabfragment to go back again to the permissions module.

I think the public api should be something like:

`suspend fun askUserToHandlePermissions(url: String, resources: Array<String>): Array<String>`

If the array is empty we do nothing because everything has been handled by us. Otherwise we show the dialog.

_Misc Settings_
- [ ] Continuing where we left off (shaka should still be in Site Permissions/Manage Sites) - use the Fire Button
- [ ] Verify that Site Permissions/Manage Sites is empty
- [ ] In "Allow all sites to ask for:" --> disable DRM
- [ ] Go to https://shaka-player-demo.appspot.com/demo/
- [ ] No consent prompt should appear and the Sintel video should be unavailable

### UI changes
Added dialog for DRM permissions and added it as a permission item in Settings

release.body:
## What's new in this release?
If you’re using Android version 13 or newer in an English-US locale, you can now enable Private Voice Search. Go to Settings > Accessibility to enable and add a voice search option to the browser address bar.

Join our fully distributed team and help raise the standard of trust online! https://duckduckgo.com/hiring

## Have feedback?
You can always reach us at https://duckduckgo.com/feedback.
